verses.roman:
śuniyā brāhmaṇa garve varṇite lāgilā
ghaṭī eke śata śloka gaṅgāra varṇilā

synonyms: śuniyā—hearing this; brāhmaṇa—the paṇḍita, Keśava Kāśmīrī; garve—in pride; varṇite—to describe; lāgilā—began; ghaṭī—hour; eke—one; śata—hundred; śloka—verses; gaṅgāra—of the Ganges; varṇilā—described.
translation: When the brāhmaṇa, Keśava Kāśmīrī, heard this, he became still more puffed up, and within one hour he composed one hundred verses describing mother Ganges.
